resources.string: Photo of location in list item
POLIN Museum of the History of Polish Jews
University of Warsaw Library and Roof Garden
The Mermaid of Warsaw Statue in Old Town
The Mermaid of Warsaw Statue in Powisle
Picturesque Bike Route along Vistula River
West entrance from Ujazdowskie Av. 1, 00–583 Warszawa
West entrance from Ujazdowskie Av. 1, 00–583 Warszawa
Museums, cinemas, theatres, colleges, offices and even a swimming pool, all located in one building which despite its communists origins became an icon of whole city.

City skyline becomes higher with every year. You can have a look at the newest apartment or office building in the City Centre like Daniel Libeskind\'s Zlota44. On the other hand you can have a look at the whole city from observation point located on 30th floor in Palace of Culture and Science.
Royal residence built in 1619. Unfortunately, destroyed during WWII, right now rebuilt accordingly to old drawings, paintings and historical informatin. Whole building is converted to a museum.
Royal, baroque palace, which architecture survived Partitions of Poland and both World Wars. Its museum is a reminder of Polish tradition and culture from before XVIII century.
Classicist palace in Royal Baths Park, the city\'s largest park, finished in 1689.
Distinctive building near the Old Town, really worth seeing.
The oldest part of the capital city, rich in restaurants, cafés and shops. Established in the 13th century, feature medieval architecture reconstructions, acknowledged by UNESCO.
City walls semicircular fortifications that surround Old Town area. Erected originally in 1540, largely destroyed during WWII.

It connects Royal Castle and Royal Baths Park. Along Royal Route most important buildings in XVII and XVIII century were located. Right now its main part – Krakowskie Przedmiescie, is considered as one of the best known and prestigious street in the city.
Although it is rare to have the filters open for tourism, the underground views are very unique. In 1886, thanks to William Lindley\'s design Warsaw got its own citywide waterworks.
Dedicated to the Warsaw Uprising of 1944 and the history of the Polish Underground State.
A museum built on the site of former Warsaw Ghetto and dedicated to the history of Polish Jews and their tragic fate during Holocaust.
Until recently, the Belvedere was the seat of the President of Poland.

Founded in 1816, it is currently one of the biggest libraries in Poland with 3 million volumes. On it\'s roof there are freely accessible, one of the largest in Europe, roof gardens, which has an area of one hectare.
Maly Powstaniec is a statue located in Old Town commemorating of the child soldiers who fought and died during the Warsaw Uprising of 1944.

The monument is dedicated to the Warsaw Uprising of 1944. It commemorates the period of 63 days of the Polish resistance movement that had fought for Poland\'s independence. During the Uprising up to 90% of Warsaw\'s buildings were destroyed by Germans.
Statue of Frédéric Chopin is located in Royal Baths Park. It commemorates Polish most famous composer and virtuoso pianist.
The statue of a Polish astronomer, Nicolaus Copernicus (Mikolaj Kopernik). Monument was designed in 1822 and it shows Copernicus holding a compass and armillary sphere.
Originally erected in 1644, located in front of Royal Castle. It commemorates King Sigismund III Vasa, who in 1596 had moved Poland\'s capital from Krakow to Warsaw.
A symbol of Warsaw, represented on the city\'s coat of arms. The oldest one of three main mermaid\'s sculptures, from 1855 is located in Market Place of Old Town.
Located near the Vistula river, the statue is made of gunmetal.
The oldest public park in the city, founded in the late 17th century.

The largest park in Warsaw (76ha), originally designed in the 17th century as a baths park. In the 18th century Lazienki was transformed by Poland\'s King Stanislaw August into a setting for palaces, villas, classicist follies, and monuments.

One of the largest in Warsaw, until World War II, a major part was occupied by an airfield and the Warsaw Polytechnic aircraft works. In that time Warsaw Airport and the Warsaw Horse Racing Track was located there.
Varsovians love kebabs. Right now there are many famous Turkish Maroccan, Libyan, Syrian, Egyptian etc. bars like Amrit, Sahara or Kebab King, but established in 1992 Efes is really worth trying.
Although usually burgers are made with minced beef, here you can try quite different approach. Have you ever eaten beef cheeks, tongue or ribs in a burger? Give them a chance!
Though located in a small shed, they have probably the best burgers in Warsaw. You should try venison version, simply delicious…

Tradition originating from communism time in Poland is eating meals in so called Milk Bars – you can try there various traditional Polish food for cheapest prices as possible (every 0,01zl counts!). The meals really taste like home made!
Cozy, traditional pizzeria, the best place to spend a romantic evening with you second half.

Warsaw is inhabitated by a lot Asian minority. It\'s hard to choose the best asian bar out of hundreds but this small spot is amongst leaders, especially when you are in vicinity of Warsaw University of Technology.
Pub or rather tap bar known for its variety of craft and local beers. Do you taste the difference between IBU10 and IBU100? Just check.
Ginourmous variety of shots (150+) and one simple price (5 PLN = 1,2 EUR). Gotta try\'em all!
Meet your friends for a coffee or a drink in a spot where nobody expects, but can have tasteful experience.
Icecreams made almost from anything edible with a use of liquid nitrogen. Compose your own tastes and toppings.
Arena of various sports – football, volleyball, motocross, windsurfing, athletics and many more. On daily basis invites you to its skirts – best spots for inline skating and longboarding.
The most famous meeting venues for young people during warm months are the stairs which spread on a lenght of few kilometers along west side of Vistula.
Dirt route prepared for cyclist let you see the Warsaw Nature Reserve of Vistula river almost in the middle of city center.
Are you into BMXs, inline skates or skateboaring? This skatepark is for you!
If you a fan of European football, you need to visit this Stadium and watch the match of best Warsaw (and probably also Polish) football team.
Commercial, office, and entertainment complex in the center of Warsaw with transparent, steel and glass, bubble–shaped roof.
At the foot of the Monument to Chopin in the Royal Lazienki you can listen to pianists of worldwide renown, who consider giving these performances an honour.

This tourist attraction located in Podzamcze district was opened in May 2011 and it is a visual show combining music, light and fountains. The ‘Water – Light – Sound’ multimedia shows take place each Friday and Saturday from May till September.
Gain some new knowledge about the world of science, whether you are child or adult.

MeetWarsaw App is a part of educational project made during Udacity Android Basics course and it serves purely educational purposes. Most of the photos used in the app are downloaded from Free Stock Photos sites: pixabay.com or pexels.com and are under CC0 licence (free to use). \n\n Nonetheless, some of the photos are under different licences and these are acknowledged in the list below:
